lead_paragraph: While the advent of electronic tolls has reduced the number of human toll takers, women who still do the job in the New York area say they are often subjected to crude behavior by drivers.

headline.print_headline: Trapped in Tollbooth, and Target of Harassment
headline.main: Trapped in Tollbooths, and Targets of Harassment

snippet: While the advent of electronic tolls has reduced the number of human toll takers, women who still do the job in the New York area say they are often subjected to crude behavior by drivers....
abstract: Women who work collecting tolls in small booths operated by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey at Holland Tunnel and elsewhere in metropolitan area are sometimes subjected to harassment by drivers; enduring lewd looks and comments, women rarely report such exchanges to their employers for variety of reasons, many reasoning it is just part of job.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bridge and Tunnel Officers Benevolent Assn

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
